snippet: The jurors found Lamont Pride guilty of second-degree murder in the death of Officer Peter Figoski, but not of a more serious charge of aggravated murder.
abstract: Lamont Pride, Brooklyn man who shot and killed New York City Police Officer Peter Figoski during a botched robbery in December 2011, is convicted of second-degree murder, but acquitted of the most serious murder charge; verdict suggests that jurors had doubts about whether Pride intentionally killed Figoski.
lead_paragraph: The jurors found Lamont Pride guilty of second-degree murder in the death of Officer Peter Figoski, but not of a more serious charge of aggravated murder.

headline.seo: Lamont Pride Convicted of Murdering Officer Peter Figoski
headline.main: Brooklyn Man Convicted of Killing Police Officer
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Man Convicted Of Killing Officer in 2011
